Material used.Description: Recombinant GST-fusion protein (37.5 pmol) was bound to glutathione-agarose beads.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutation A30P reduced the binding of a-synuclein to type A liposomes by 95% and to type B liposomes by 53%.
Mutation E46K increased the binding of a-synuclein to type A liposomes by 88% and to type B liposomes by 56%.
Mutation A53T led to a non-significant 9-12% reduction in the binding of a-synuclein to both liposome types.

Biological replicates.Description: Measurements obtained from three independent protein preparations.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-specific binding due to GST bound to beads was subtracted.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding similar to wild-type a-synuclein (taken as 100%).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation (>50% change) from wild-type a-synuclein binding.

Material used.Description: Untagged a-synuclein proteins were used at 400 µM in 30 mM Mops, pH 7.2.

Readout description.Result Description: The rate of assembly of the A30P mutant was slower than for wild-type a-synuclein, but the amount of assembly was similar to that of the E46K and A53T mutants at 98 h.
E46K a-synuclein showed a faster rate of assembly and a 2.5-fold greater total assembly than the wild-type protein at 98 h.
The A53T mutant behaved in a similar way to E46K a-synuclein with a faster rate of assembly.

Biological replicates.Description: Measurements obtained from three independent protein preparations.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein assembly used as reference.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Assembly rate and total assembly similar to wild-type a-synuclein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase or decrease in assembly rate or total assembly compared to wild-type a-synuclein.

Material used.Description: Aliquots of assembly mixtures were placed on carbon-coated 400-mesh grids and stained with 1% potassium phosphotungstate.

Readout description.Result Description: Morphologies of filaments of A30P a-synucleins were very similar to wild-type, having a filament width of 6-9 nm.
Filaments assembled from E46K a-synuclein often showed a pronounced twisted appearance, with width varying between about 5 and 14 nm, and a cross-over spacing of about 43 nm.

Images of filaments made from the A53T mutant tended to show a more marked periodic variation in width between about 5 and 14 nm, giving a twisted appearance with a cross-over spacing of about 100 nm.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein filament morphology used as reference.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Filament morphology similar to wild-type a-synuclein (width of 6-9 nm with slight periodic variation).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in filament morphology (e.g., pronounced twisting or altered cross-over spacing) compared to wild-type a-synuclein.
